title: Tasks List Response
description: Response from task listing query with filtered results and state reconciliation data across all AdCP domains

query_summary.description: Summary of the query that was executed

total_matching.description: Total number of tasks matching filters (across all pages)

returned.description: Number of tasks returned in this response

media-buy.description: Number of media-buy tasks in results

signals.description: Number of signals tasks in results

filters_applied.description: List of filters that were applied to the query

tasks.description: Array of tasks matching the query criteria

task_type.title: Task Type

enumDescriptions.create_media_buy: Media-buy domain: Create a new advertising campaign with one or more packages
enumDescriptions.update_media_buy: Media-buy domain: Update campaign settings, package configuration, or delivery parameters
enumDescriptions.sync_creatives: Media-buy domain: Sync creative assets to publisher's library with upsert semantics
enumDescriptions.activate_signal: Signals domain: Activate an audience signal on a specific platform or account
enumDescriptions.get_signals: Signals domain: Discover available audience signals based on natural language description
enumDescriptions.create_property_list: Property domain: Create a new property list with filters and brand manifest
enumDescriptions.update_property_list: Property domain: Update an existing property list
enumDescriptions.get_property_list: Property domain: Retrieve a property list with resolved properties
enumDescriptions.list_property_lists: Property domain: List all accessible property lists
enumDescriptions.delete_property_list: Property domain: Delete a property list

notes: Task types map to specific AdCP task operations
Each task type belongs to the 'media-buy', 'signals', 'property', or 'creative' domain
This enum is used in task management APIs (tasks/list, tasks/get) and webhook payloads
New task types require a minor version bump per semantic versioning

domain.description: AdCP domain this task belongs to

enumDescriptions.submitted: Task accepted and queued for long-running execution (hours to days). Client should poll with tasks/get or provide webhook_url at protocol level.
enumDescriptions.working: Agent is actively processing the task, expect completion within 120 seconds
enumDescriptions.input-required: Task is paused and waiting for input from the user (e.g., clarification, approval)
enumDescriptions.canceled: Task was canceled by the user
enumDescriptions.failed: Task failed due to an error during execution
enumDescriptions.rejected: Task was rejected by the agent and was not started
enumDescriptions.unknown: Task is in an unknown or indeterminate state

created_at.description: When the task was initially created (ISO 8601)

updated_at.description: When the task was last updated (ISO 8601)

completed_at.description: When the task completed (ISO 8601, only for completed/failed/canceled tasks)

has_webhook.description: Whether this task has webhook configuration

limit.description: Limit that was applied to this query

offset.description: Offset that was applied to this query

has_more.description: Whether there are more tasks beyond this page

next_offset.description: Offset to use for next page (only present if has_more is true)

context.title: Context Object
context.description: Opaque correlation data that is echoed unchanged in responses. Used for internal tracking, UI session IDs, trace IDs, and other caller-specific identifiers that don't affect protocol behavior. Context data is never parsed by AdCP agents - it's simply preserved and returned.

ext.title: Extension Object
ext.description: Extension object for platform-specific, vendor-namespaced parameters. Extensions are always optional and must be namespaced under a vendor/platform key (e.g., ext.gam, ext.roku). Used for custom capabilities, partner-specific configuration, and features being proposed for standardization.

_bundled.note: This is a bundled schema with all $ref resolved inline. For the modular version with references, use the parent directory.
